It seemed that the family was a large and a wealthy one, with a great many servants and a very considerable establishment. They were mostly a quiet lot, but there was one young fellow, a footman, who was a bit of a character. He was always getting into scrapes and causing trouble, and the other servants didn't have much to do with him. I pricked up my ears at this, for I had a feeling that this young man might be just the person I was looking for. I asked the ostlers if they knew anything about his past, but they didn't seem to know much. They said he had just appeared one day, and had been taken on by the family without any references. Holmes và tôi đuổi theo sau, trong khi đám đông vẫn tiếp tục la hét và chạy đi tìm chỗ an toàn. Chúng tôi chạy qua những con phố nhỏ, qua những cánh cửa, và cuối cùng đã bắt được người đàn ông đó trong một con hẻm nhỏ. "Tại sao bạn làm điều đó?" Holmes hỏi, khi chúng tôi giữ chặt người đàn ông đó. Người đàn ông đó nhìn xuống đất, không dám nhìn vào mắt chúng tôi. "Tôi không có lựa chọn nào khác," anh ta nói. "Tôi đã bị ép buộc phải làm điều đó." "Ai đã ép buộc bạn?" Holmes hỏi. Người đàn ông đó nhìn xung quanh, như thể sợ rằng có ai đó đang lắng nghe. "Tôi không thể nói," anh ta nói. "Tôi sẽ bị giết nếu tôi nói." Holmes nhìn vào mắt người đàn ông đó, như thể đang tìm kiếm một manh mối nào đó. "Chúng tôi sẽ bảo vệ bạn," anh ta nói. "Hãy nói cho chúng tôi biết sự thật." Người đàn ông đó nhìn xuống đất, rồi bắt đầu kể một câu chuyện dài về một tổ chức bí mật, về những người đã ép buộc anh ta phải gây ra vụ hỏa hoạn. Chúng tôi lắng nghe, và khi người đàn ông đó kết thúc câu chuyện, chúng tôi đã hiểu được toàn bộ sự thật.

I walked to the nearest telegraph office and sent a message to the address which had been given me, asking if there was any news. The answer was that a letter would be sent by the evening post. I then went to the railway station and made inquiries about the trains, but I could learn nothing that would help me. It was a long and dreary day, and I felt like a man who is waiting for the verdict of a jury. At last the evening came, and I went to the post office and inquired if there was a letter for me. The clerk handed me a letter, and I tore it open and read it. It was from the man who had written to me before, and it told me that he would be in London that night and would call upon me at my house. I went home and waited, and at last I heard the doorbell ring. I went to the door and opened it, and there was the man standing on the step. He came in and we talked for a long time, and what he told me was so strange and so wonderful that I can hardly believe it now.

Holmes sat up straight and looked around cautiously before instructing the driver to wait. He then turned to me and said, "We have arrived, Watson. This is the location where Lady Emily's brother was last seen." I followed Holmes out of the cab and onto the sidewalk, where he began to examine the building's exterior with great interest. After a few moments, he turned to me and said, "I believe our culprit has left us a clue, Watson. Observe the window on the third floor. The one with the broken pane." I followed his gaze and saw that indeed one of the windows was broken, and there were signs of a struggle on the fire escape. "It appears our man was in a hurry," Holmes remarked, "and did not bother to clean up after himself." With that, he turned and entered the building, leaving me to follow close behind.

Bay Holmes ise sadece olay yerinden aldığı birkaç iz ve ipucuyla cinayetin nasıl işlendiğini ve kimin işlediğini çözmeyi başarmıştı. Ben ise bu olayı dinlerken hayretler içinde kalmıştım. Bay Holmes'un zekâsına ve yeteneklerine gerçekten hayran olmuştum.

en_first_half: “Away we went then, and we drove for at least an hour. Colonel Lysander Stark had said that it was only seven miles, but I should think, from the rate that we seemed to go, and from the time that we took, that it must have been nearer twelve. He sat at my side in silence all the time, and I was aware, more than once when I glanced in his direction, that he was looking at me with great intensity. The country roads seem to be not very good in that part of the world, for we lurched and jolted terribly. I tried to look out of the windows to see something of where we were, but they were made of frosted glass, and I could make out nothing save the occasional bright blur
en_second_half: of a passing light. Now and then I hazarded some remark to break the monotony of the journey, but the colonel answered only in monosyllables, and the conversation soon flagged. At last, however, the bumping of the road was exchanged for the crisp smoothness of a gravel-drive, and the carriage came to a stand. Colonel Lysander Stark sprang out, and, as I followed after him, pulled me swiftly into a porch which gaped in front of us. We stepped, as it were, right out of the carriage and into the hall, so that I failed to catch the most fleeting glance of the front of the house. The instant that I had crossed the threshold the door slammed heavily behind us, and I heard faintly the rattle of the wheels as the carriage drove away.
en_results: of a street lamp or the gleam of a wet leaf. The darkness seemed to press in around us, and I felt a growing sense of unease as the minutes ticked by. The driver, a gruff-looking man with a thick beard, seemed to be taking a circuitous route, and I wondered if we were lost. I glanced at my watch, but it was too dark to see the time. I was starting to feel a sense of panic rising up, and I forced myself to take slow, deep breaths. Suddenly, the carriage lurched to a stop, and Colonel Stark spoke up, his voice low and gravelly. "We're here," he said, and the driver jumped down from his seat to open the door. I stepped out into the darkness, stretching my cramped limbs, and looked around. We were standing in front of a large, looming house, its windows like empty eyes staring back at me. I felt a shiver run down my spine as Colonel Stark took my arm and led me towards the front door. "Welcome to my home," he said, his voice dripping with an unsettling hospitality. As we stepped inside, I couldn't shake the feeling that I was walking into a trap, and that I might never escape.

Những con đường làng ở đoạn này có vẻ không được tốt lắm vì chúng tôi cứ bị lắc lư và xóc nẩy dữ dội. es_first_half: "Nos fuimos entonces, y condujimos durante al menos una hora. El coronel Lysander Stark había dicho que sólo eran siete millas, pero yo creía, por la velocidad a la que parecíamos ir, y por el tiempo que tardamos, que debían ser más de doce. Se sentó a mi lado en silencio todo el tiempo, y me di cuenta, más de una vez cuando miré en su dirección, que me estaba mirando con gran intensidad. Parece que las carreteras rurales no son muy buenas en esa parte del mundo, porque dimos unos bandazos y sacudidas terribles. Intenté mirar por las ventanillas para ver algo de dónde estábamos, pero eran de vidrio esmerilado, y no pude distinguir nada más que el borrón ocasional de una luz que pasaba. De vez en
es_second_half: cuando me arriesgaba a hacer algún comentario para romper la monotonía del viaje, pero el coronel sólo respondía con monosílabos, y la conversación pronto decaía. Por fin, sin embargo, los golpes de la carretera fueron sustituidos por la crujiente suavidad de un camino de grava, y el carruaje se detuvo. El coronel Lysander Stark se bajó de él y, mientras yo lo seguía, me arrastró a un porche que se abría ante nosotros. Bajamos, por así decirlo, del carruaje y entramos en el vestíbulo, de modo que no pude echar la más fugaz mirada a la fachada de la casa. En el instante en que crucé el umbral, la puerta se cerró de golpe detrás de nosotros, y oí débilmente el traqueteo de las ruedas mientras el carruaje se alejaba."

El coronel Stark no parecía inmutarse por el movimiento, pero yo me sentía cada vez más mareado. Finalmente, después de lo que me pareció una eternidad, el coche se detuvo y el coronel Stark se inclinó hacia adelante para abrir la puerta. "Hemos llegado", dijo, y salió del coche con una agilidad que me sorprendió, considerando su edad. Me apeé del coche con algo de dificultad, estirando mis piernas entumecidas y mirando a mi alrededor. Estábamos en un lugar completamente oscuro, sin ninguna luz a la vista, excepto la del coche, que iluminaba un pequeño claro rodeado de árboles. El coronel Stark se acercó a mí y me puso una mano en el hombro. "Vamos", dijo, y comenzamos a caminar hacia la oscuridad. No podía ver nada, pero podía sentir que estábamos subiendo una colina, y que el aire se estaba volviendo más frío y húmedo. De repente, oí un ruido detrás de nosotros y me di la vuelta, pero no pude ver nada. "¿Qué fue eso?", pregunté al coronel Stark, pero él no respondió. Siguió caminando, y yo lo seguí, mi corazón latiendo con una creciente sensación de aprensión. ¿Qué nos esperaba en la cima de esa colina? ¿Y qué era ese ruido que había oído? No podía sacudir la sensación de que estábamos siendo observados, de que había algo o alguien allí afuera, en la oscuridad, esperando por nosotros.
tr_first_half: "Derken yola çıktıktan sonra en az bir saat boyunca gittik. Albay Lysander Stark bana yalnızca yedi mil demişti ama gittiğimiz hızı ve süreyi düşündüğümde en az on iki mil olduğuna bahse girerim. Bütün yol boyunca yanımda sessizce oturdu. Ara sıra ona doğru göz ucuyla baktığımda, beni büyük bir dikkatle incelediğini fark ettim. Oraların yolları bozuktu galiba, çünkü feci bir şekilde sallanıp duruyorduk. Dışarı bakıp nerede olduğumu bilmek istediysem de pencereler buzlu camla kaplanmış olduğu için görebildiğim tek şey, yanından ara sıra geçtiğimiz ışıkların

en_first_half: “It was pitch dark inside the house, and the colonel fumbled about looking for matches and muttering under his breath. Suddenly a door opened at the other end of the passage, and a long, golden bar of light shot out in our direction. It grew broader, and a woman appeared with a lamp in her hand, which she held above her head, pushing her face forward and peering at us. I could see that she was pretty, and from the gloss with which the light shone
en_second_half: upon her dark dress I knew that it was a rich material. She spoke a few words in a foreign tongue in a tone as though asking a question, and when my companion answered in a gruff monosyllable she gave such a start that the lamp nearly fell from her hand. Colonel Stark went up to her, whispered something in her ear, and then, pushing her back into the room from whence she had come, he walked towards me again with the lamp in his hand.
en_results: on her dark hair, I gathered that she was young. Her eyes, which seemed to bore into our very souls, sparkled with curiosity, and her lips, which were full and inviting, curled into a gentle smile as she took in our disheveled appearance. The colonel, still muttering to himself, stumbled forward, his eyes fixed on the lamp, and the woman, with a soft laugh, beckoned us to follow her. As we trailed behind her, the light from the lamp casting
en_results_raw: on her dark hair, I gathered that she was young. Her eyes, which seemed to bore into our very souls, sparkled with curiosity, and her lips, which were full and inviting, curled into a gentle smile as she took in our disheveled appearance. The colonel, still muttering to himself, stumbled forward, his eyes fixed on the lamp, and the woman, with a soft laugh, beckoned us to follow her. As we trailed behind her, the light from the lamp casting eerie shadows on the walls, I couldn't help but feel a sense of trepidation. Who was this mysterious woman, and what was her connection to the colonel and this forsaken house? The air inside was thick with the scent of decay and rot, and I could feel the weight of secrets and stories untold bearing down upon me. The woman led us to a grand, high-ceilinged room, the walls of which were lined with cobweb-shrouded portraits, their subjects' eyes seeming to follow us as we moved. A fire crackled in the hearth, casting a warm glow over the space, and the woman, setting the lamp down on a nearby table, turned to us with an expectant smile. "Welcome to my home," she said, her voice low and husky. "I am Emily. And you, gentlemen, are just in time for dinner."

Me sentí un poco confundido por su belleza, y me pregunté quién sería esta mujer y qué relación tendría con el coronel. La mujer se acercó más a nosotros y nos invitó a entrar en la casa, y el coronel aceptó con un gesto de agradecimiento. Entramos en la casa, y la mujer nos llevó a una habitación grande y acogedora, con una chimenea encendida y un sofá cómodo. Nos sentamos y la mujer se sentó enfrente de nosotros, con la lámpara todavía en la mano, y comenzó a hablar con el coronel en voz baja. Me sentí un poco fuera de lugar, pero la mujer me sonrió de nuevo y me hizo sentir más cómodo. Empezó a hablar conmigo, y me contó que se llamaba Sofía y que era la hija del coronel. Me habló de su vida en la casa y de sus intereses, y me sentí atraído por su personalidad y su belleza. El coronel se levantó y se disculpó, diciendo que tenía que atender a algunos asuntos, y nos dejó solos a Sofía y a mí. Me sentí un poco nervioso, pero Sofía me sonrió y me hizo sentir más relajado. Empezamos a hablar de todo tipo de cosas, desde la literatura hasta la música, y me di cuenta de que teníamos mucho en común. La noche pasó volando, y antes de que me diera cuenta, el coronel regresó y nos dijo que era hora de cenar. Sofía se levantó y nos llevó a la mesa, donde nos esperaba una deliciosa comida. La cena fue agradable, y me sentí como si hubiera conocido a Sofía durante años. Después de cenar, nos sentamos en el salón y seguimos hablando, y me di cuenta de que me había enamorado de Sofía. Me sentí un poco asustado, pero también emocionado por la posibilidad de conocerla mejor. La noche terminó demasiado pronto, y el coronel me acompañó a la puerta, agradeciéndome por haber venido. Me sentí un poco triste al dejar a Sofía, pero sabía que la vería de nuevo pronto. Salí de la casa y me dirigí hacia mi hogar, con la imagen de Sofía grabada en mi mente.
